greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. A(x) defined by: A(x)^2 consists entirely of integer coefficients between 1 and 2 (A083952); A(x) is the unique power series solution with A(0)=1.
comment: Let A_n(x) be the power series formed from the first n terms of this sequence. Then a(0) = 1, a(n) = floor(1 - [x^n] (A_(n-1)(x))^2/2). Replacing 2 with a larger integer k generates the related sequences A084203-A084212. - _Charlie Neder_, Jan 16 2019
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1024

N. Heninger, E. M. Rains and N. J. A. Sloane, On the Integrality of n-th Roots of Generating Functions, arXiv:math/0509316 [math.NT], 2005-2006; J. Combinatorial Theory, Series A, 113 (2006), 1732-1745.
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = Block[{s = Sum[a[i]*x^i, {i, 0, n - 1}]}, If[ IntegerQ@ Last@ CoefficientList[ Series[ Sqrt[s + x^n], {x, 0, n}], x], 1, 2]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 42}]; CoefficientList[ Series[ Sqrt[ Sum[ a[i]*x^i, {i, 0, 42}]], {x, 0, 42}], x] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 11 2007 *)
program: {a(n) = my(A=[1]); for(i=0,n, A=concat(A,0); A[#A] = floor(1 - polcoeff( Ser(A)^2, #A-1)/2) ); A[n+1]}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, May 19 2003
